member.remarks: Use this to define match room parameters such as room name, maximum number of members, password, etc. You can also define custom values , ..., , and that can be used later in a condition for SearchRoom.

member.name: P:SoftGear.Strix.Unity.Runtime.RoomProperties.name
member.summary:
The name of the room.
You can set the name when creating the room or change it later using SetRoom if you are the room's owner.

member.name: P:SoftGear.Strix.Unity.Runtime.RoomProperties.capacity
member.summary:
Maximum number of room members. This value gets clamped to [minRoomCapacity, maxRoomCapacity] range as configured on the server. If not specified, 4 is used by default.
You can set the capacity when creating a match room or change it later using SetRoom if you are the room's owner.

member.name: P:SoftGear.Strix.Unity.Runtime.RoomProperties.password
member.summary:
Room entry password. If set, new players must provide a matching password to join the room. Empty by default.
You can set the password when creating a match room or change it later using SetRoom if you are the room's owner.

member.name: P:SoftGear.Strix.Unity.Runtime.RoomProperties.state
member.summary: An integer value that can be used for application's own purposes.

member.name: P:SoftGear.Strix.Unity.Runtime.RoomProperties.isJoinable
member.summary:
Determines if new players are allowed to join the room; by default.
You can make the room unjoinable when creating it or change the joinability later using SetRoom if you are the room's owner.

member.summary: Establishes a connection with a remote server.
member.remarks: If the connection with another host is already established, it will be closed before opening a new one.
member.param: The address of the remote server. Can be either URL, IPv4 address, or IPv6 address.
The port number of the remote server. Must be between 1 and 65535.
The protocol used to connect to the remote server. If this parameter is "UDP" (upper case), then UDP protocol is used. Otherwise, TCP is used.
This callback is invoked when the connection to the remote server has been established successfully.
This callback is invoked when the connection could not be established.
Timeout for establishing the connection. Currently doesn't work.

member.name: T:SoftGear.Strix.Unity.Runtime.StrixAnimationSynchronizer
member.summary: Component that enables animation synchronization.
member.remarks:
Adding this component to an object will enable automatic animation synchronization. Animation synchronization is performed by synchronizing Animator's state and parameters.
You can uncheck some of the parameters in the inspector to disable their synchronization. This may be useful in situations when parameters can be set locally based on some conditions like character being grounded.

member.summary: If set to , will synchronize Mecanim states.

member.name: F:SoftGear.Strix.Unity.Runtime.StrixAnimationSynchronizer.ParameterSynchronizationFlags
member.summary: A list of flags that determine whether specific animation parameters should be synchronized or not.
member.remarks: Each of the elements here corresponds to a parameter in Animator.parameters. Although you can set these through code, there's a custom inspector in Strix Unity SDK that allows you to modify the list in a more user-friendly way.

member.name: M:SoftGear.Strix.Unity.Runtime.StrixBehaviour.Rpc(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Calls an RPC on the room member who owns the object.
member.remarks: The method has to be defined on the same class and marked with attribute. Target member must be in the same match room as you.
member.param: RPC method name.
A list of method arguments. This should match the arguments in the method definition, both in number and respective types.

member.name: M:SoftGear.Strix.Unity.Runtime.StrixBehaviour.Rpc(System.String,SoftGear.Strix.Unity.Runtime.Event.RpcSuccessEventHandler,SoftGear.Strix.Unity.Runtime.Event.FailureEventHandler,System.Object[])
member.summary: Calls an RPC on the room member who owns the object.
member.remarks:
The method has to be defined on the same class and marked with attribute. Target member must be in the same match room as you.
Possible error codes:
Server did not respond within the specified timeout interval.
You're trying to send an RPC message while not being joined to a room.
Failed to send the request because of a connection error.
The object is not being synchronized over the network.
member.param: RPC method name.
This handler is called when the RPC has been processed successfully.
This handler is called in case there was an error when processing the RPC.
A list of method arguments. This should match the arguments in the method definition, both in number and respective types.

member.name: M:SoftGear.Strix.Unity.Runtime.StrixNetwork.ConnectMasterServer(System.String,SoftGear.Strix.Unity.Runtime.Event.StrixNetworkConnectEventHandler,SoftGear.Strix.Unity.Runtime.Event.StrixNetworkConnectFailedEventHandler)
member.summary: Establishes a connection with a master server on port 9122.
member.remarks:
Before calling this method you should set . It can be found on the Information tab of the Dashboard on the Strix Cloud web page. If already connected, calling this method with different will close the existing connection before opening a new one. This overload uses port 9122 implicitly. If you wish to specify another port use . The connection establishment timeout is 30 seconds.
Possible exception types in 's :
Strix error which can be further separated by an error code:
Failed to send the request because of a connection error.
Credentials type does not match the server authentication configuration. This can happen if, for example, the server is configured to authenticate by password instead of application ID. On Strix Cloud this error should never occur since currently it always uses application ID authentication.
Internal server error. This can be caused by a bug or some other problem on the server and should be reported to the developers.
Current client library is not supported by the server. This can happen if the client version is too old. To fix this error, update the Strix SDK to the latest version.
Application ID token provided via does not match the one on the server. Check if the application ID is the same as the one listed on Information tab of the Dashboard on the Strix Cloud web page.
An error occurred when attempting to access the socket.
There has been an error when connecting to the authentication server.
It's either an HTTP error such as 404/Not Found, or a network error like failure to resolve a DNS entry, a socket error, etc.
When using an authentication server this error can happen if the server returns an invalid authorization token.
It could be an invalid UTF-8 string or an invalid JSON.
This can happen if the address for the given host couldn't be resolved when establishing socket connection.
member.param: The address of the master server. Can be either URL, IPv4 address, or IPv6 address.
This callback is invoked when the connection to the master server has been established successfully.
This callback is invoked in case the connection could not be established.
member.exception: Thrown if port does not lie within 0-65535 range.

To use this method you have to connect to the master server at least once. If disconnected, calling this method will reconnect to the master server with the last used host and port parameters.
Possible exception types in 's :
Strix error which can be further separated by an error code:
Failed to send the request because of a connection error.
Server did not respond within the specified timeout interval.
member.param: Limits the number of search results. This value must be greater than 0.
The starting offset in the search results, e.g. if limit is set to 10, and offset is set to 15, the search will result in rooms 15 to 25.
This callback is invoked when the room search completes.
This callback is invoked in case of a failure.
If not null, used to configure the request timeout. Default timeout is 30 seconds. See for more details.
member.exception: Thrown if called before connecting to the master server.

member.summary: Creates a new room with the given properties and immediately joins the room as the owner with the given member properties.
member.remarks:
To use this method you have to connect to the master server at least once. If disconnected, calling this method will reconnect to the master server with the last used host and port parameters.
Possible exception types in 's :
Strix error which can be further separated by an error code:
Failed to send the request because of a connection error.
Server did not respond within the specified timeout interval.
Could not leave the current room before creating a new one. Either the room does not exist or you're not a member of this room.
Credentials type does not match the server authentication configuration. This can happen if, for example, the server is configured to authenticate by password instead of application ID. On Strix Cloud this error should never occur since currently it always uses application ID authentication.
Internal server error. This can be caused by a bug or some other problem on the server and should be reported to the developers.
Current client library is not supported by the server. This can happen if the client version is too old. To fix this error, update the Strix SDK to the latest version.
Application ID token provided via does not match the one on the server. Check if the application ID is the same as the one listed on Information tab of the Dashboard on the Strix Cloud web page.
An error occurred when attempting to access the socket.
There has been an error when connecting to the authentication server.
It's either an HTTP error such as 404/Not Found, or a network error like failure to resolve a DNS entry, a socket error, etc.
When using an authentication server this error can happen if the server returns an invalid authorization token.
It could be an invalid UTF-8 string or an invalid JSON.
This can happen if the address for the given host couldn't be resolved when establishing socket connection.

member.name: M:SoftGear.Strix.Unity.Runtime.StrixSerializationProperties.RegisterIndexOfProperty(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Associates a string key with an integer value. Used in conjunction with and .
member.remarks: When serializing properties you have the option to either use an integer as a key (), or a string (), e.g. a property name. When using , the string key is still replaced with an integer code, and by default the hash value calculated from the string is used. You can change this behaviour by explicitly registering a specific string with a specific code. Since smaller positive values are compressed better at serialization level, this can be useful for reducing network traffic. Although, you have to be careful not to use the same code value twice.
member.param: Name of the property.
Integer code to be associated with the property name.
